intro: Erigeron arizonicus, commonly known as Arizona blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as plains, grasslands, and rocky soils. It has silvery-green leaves with a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss in its dry habitat. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a blue to purple color that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
